content: In the world of literature, which British author created the fictional detective Sherlock Holmes?

Sir Arthur Conan Doyle is the British author who created the iconic fictional detective Sherlock Holmes. Holmes first appeared in print in 1887 in the novel "A Study in Scarlet." Over the years, Doyle wrote numerous stories featuring Holmes and his assistant, Dr. John Watson, which have since become classics of the mystery and detective fiction genres.
